intro: Anomalocalyx uleanus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a deciduous shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
